Dating: 19TH DYNASTY (not before); NEW KINGDOM; 20TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Anepigraphic shabti
Description: Shabti of an overseer or group supervisor of very crude appearance. He is wearing a triangular skirt and is holding his hands together on the breast, although these are hardly visible. He has neither agricultural equipment nor small seed basket. It is clearly visible that a mould has been used.
